DataDescription Class Reference
[Entity]

This class is used to describe a type of data associated with an entity class. More...

#include <data_description.hpp>

static WatcherPtr pWatcher ()

Detailed Description

This class is used to describe a type of data associated with an entity class.

const char * DataDescription::getDataFlagsAsStr (  )  const

This method returns the data flags as a string (hopefully looking like the one specified in the defs file).

void DataDescription::index ( int  index  ) 

This method sets the index of this property.

This will normally be called when parsing this property from xml at startup.

int DataDescription::index (  )  const

This method returns the index of this property.

Indicies are ordered sequentially, based on the order of their definition in the entities.xml file.

bool DataDescription::isBaseData (  )  const

This method returns true if this property is stored on a base rather than on a cell.

bool DataDescription::isCellData (  )  const

This method returns true if this property is stored on a cell rather than on a base.

bool DataDescription::isClientServerData (  )  const

This method returns true if changes in the property should be propogated to all nearby clients, including the owner of the entity.

See also:
isOtherClientData()

isOwnClientData()

const std::string & DataDescription::name (  )  const

bool DataDescription::parse ( DataSectionPtr  pSection,
const std::string &  parentName,
PARSE_OPTIONS  options = PARSE_DEFAULT 
)

This method parses a data description.

Parameters:
pSection The data section to parse.
parentName The name of the parent or an empty string if not parent exists.
options Additional parsing options. At the moment, the option PARSE_IGNORE_FLAGS is used by User Data Objects to ignore the 'Flags' section instead of failing to parse.
Returns:
true if successful

DataSectionPtr DataDescription::pDefaultSection (  )  const

This method returns the default value section of this property.

PyObjectPtr DataDescription::pInitialValue (  )  const

This method returns the initial value of this data item, as a Python object.

It returns a smart pointer to avoid refcounting problems.

WatcherPtr DataDescription::pWatcher (  )  [static]
